title: Afghanistan: The 'undefeated' Panjshir Valley - an hour from Kabul
description: The Panjshir Valley has been a flashpoint in Afghanistan's turbulent history - now it's happening again.

title: The hard men removing squatters in Spain
description: Some squatters in Spain demand cash before leaving - so eviction firms have arisen to handle the talks.

title: The real victims of mass crypto-hacks that keep happening
description: Millions in Bitcoin and other digital coins are being stolen by hackers with victims left in limbo.

title: Why rent control isn’t working in Sweden
description: Young people are struggling to afford city living, and even the Swedes can't crack the problem.

title: Kenya's Deputy President Ruto campaigns for 'Hustler Nation'
description: Deputy President William Ruto is portraying himself as the champion of the poor ahead of elections.

title: Afghanistan: 'The pain of watching my country burn from afar'
description: Hundreds of Afghan have taken refuge in India but they are worried about their families back home.

title: Tortoise eating bird caught on camera by conservationist
description: It is believed to be the first time this behaviour of giant tortoises has been documented.

title: Tokyo Paralympics 2020: Kgothatso Montjane, South Africa's wheelchair tennis hope
description: South Africa's wheelchair tennis star Kgothatso Montjane is aiming for a medal at the Tokyo Paralympics.

title: Nile Rodgers offers career tips to young musicians
description: After months of staying at home, the music legend taught young Londoners the benefit of collaboration.

title: 'My husband refused a divorce for nine years'
description: Under orthodox Jewish law, a husband must give his wife a document to allow the marriage to end.

title: Aryana Sayeed: Afghanistan returns to miserable time for women
description: Afghan singer Aryana Sayeed on fleeing the country and her concerns for those who remain.

title: Afghanistan: Why can't the UK hold Kabul airport without the US?
description: The US and UK have different timetables for the effort to evacuate people from Afghanistan

title: Afghanistan: The Sandhurst sisterhood trying to save Afghans
description: Desperate Afghans have been messaging British veterans they used to work with asking for help.

title: Six-time champion Williams pulls out of US Open
description: Six-time champion Serena Williams becomes the latest high-profile player to pull out of next week's US Open.

title: England captain Kane says he is 'staying at Tottenham this summer'
description: England captain Harry Kane says he will be "staying at Tottenham this summer" and is "00% focused on helping the team achieve success".

title: Tears on the tarmac as Afghan journalist speaks to BBC
description: Wahida Faizi says she cannot stay in Afghanistan because she believes the Taliban will kill her.

title: Afghanistan: How much opium is produced and what's the Taliban's record?
description: The Taliban claims opium poppy cultivation was stopped when it last held power in Afghanistan.

title: Tokyo Paralympics: Sarah Storey wins 15th Paralympic gold as GB claim six medals
description: Britain's Sarah Storey wins her 15th Paralympic title for Britain's first gold medal at the Tokyo Games.

title: England v India: James Anderson has captain Virat Kohli caught behind for seven
description: India captain Virat Kohli is caught behind for seven as James Anderson claims his third wicket to help England reduce the tourists to 21-3 in the third Test at Headingley.

title: Dominic Raab: With hindsight I wouldn't have gone on holiday
description: But the foreign secretary says the idea he was "lounging on the beach" as the Taliban advanced was "nonsense".

title: Police need clearer guidance on Tasers - watchdog
description: Black people are more likely to face a Taser, a report from the independent police watchdog finds.

title: Real Madrid make £137m bid for Paris St-Germain star Mbappe
description: Real Madrid make a £137m bid to sign Paris St-Germain forward Kylian Mbappe.

title: Club completes challenge to bag all 282 Munros in a single day
description: Members of Carnethy Hill Running Club reached the summits of all 282 mountains in a single day.

title: Afghanistan: UK offers to help evacuate rescue animals and staff
description: Ben Wallace says the charity's plane will be found a slot so staff and animals can leave Afghanistan.

title: Covid infection protection waning in double jabbed
description: Experts say it is to be expected and boosters may be needed, at least for some people, ahead of winter.

title: Nirvana sued by the baby from Nevermind's album cover
description: Spencer Elden, who was photographed as a four month-old, is alleging child pornography.

title: Church of England 'regret' over suicide of falsely accused priest
description: The Church admits "unreasonable pressures" were put on Fr Alan Griffin before he killed himself.

title: Bilal Sarwary: 'The plane hit the tower and all our lives changed'
description: Afghan journalist Bilal Sarwary was selling carpets when 9/11 happened. From that day on, everything changed.

title: Afghanistan chaos: The British families in limbo
description: The stories of Britons stuck in Kabul, families in limbo and Afghans starting new lives in the UK.

title: Charlie Watts: Jagger and Richards pay tribute to Rolling Stones bandmate
description: The Rolling Stones' Mick Jagger and Keith Richards salute drummer Charlie Watts, who has died aged 80.

title: Claudia Lawrence: Mum in 'utter shock' at new search
description: Joan Lawrence says "every single day is a nightmare" since her daughter disappeared in 2009.

title: Tokyo Paralympics: Sarah Storey wins first British gold medal in style
description: Watch Sarah Storey claim Britain's first gold medal of the Tokyo Paralympics in the Women's C5 3000m individual pursuit by beating compatriot Crystal Lane-Wright in the final.

title: From Rhondda to Greenham and the US Supreme Court
description: Forty years ago, three sisters began their protest against US nuclear missiles coming to the UK.

title: Levelling up: The seaside town debating what change is needed
description: As a report says levelling up plans must consider local views, people in Rhyl debate the changes needed.

title: The Papers: 'Race' to leave Kabul and Charlie Watts' tributes
description: The final days of the UK evacuations from Afghanistan and the death of the Rolling Stones drummer are the focus for the front pages.

title: Haiti earthquake: Mother mourns daughter killed during christening
description: Locals say 22 people died when a church collapsed during a mass christening.

title: Charlie Watts: The subtle magnificence of the Rolling Stones' drummer
description: He wasn't flashy or prone to pyrotechnics, but Charlie Watts was the heartbeat of the Rolling Stones.
